name: Deep Learning Research Engineer (Head avatar project)
description:
We are looking for a Deep Learning Research Engineer for the head avatar project.

In our research, we pursue multiple topics, including novel view synthesis, image animation, pose estimation, and model compression. Our team is led by experienced researchers with a track record of publications, and additional consulting is provided by Prof. Victor Lempitsky. We have both the opportunities to publish papers as well as to innovate and assist in making new products.

GitHub with our prior works: http://saic-violet.github.io/

Responsibilities:

  • Reading and understanding scientific papers and publicly available implementations
  • Generate, discuss and implement ideas on:
    • which datasets to use, and how to use,
    • which architecture to train,
    • what the objectives are,
    • what training regime to choose,
    • how to evaluate
  • Writing papers for the world's leading computer vision conferences
  • Collecting and processing the datasets
  • Preparation of materials for patent applications
  • Contributing to Proof-of-Concepts and demo applications, following the specified APIs for code integration with other modules
  • Writing technical reports and presenting results to colleagues or a broader audience

Requirements:

  • 2+ years in neural networks implementation, training and debugging experience
  • In-depth understanding of computer vision neural network layers
  • Strong Python and knowledge of standard algorithms and data structures
  • Familiarity with modern trends and latest achievements in the field

As a plus:

  • Experience in
    • image generation with neural networks
    • GANs
    • neural rendering
    • computer graphics
    • human pose estimation
    • mobile development & optimization of CNN for mobile
  • Publications at CV/ML conferences
  • Competitive ML achievements, e.g. Kaggle

Work conditions:

  • Great team with track record of papers on top conferences
  • Challenging research & engineering tasks at the cutting edge of the modern computer vision
  • Nice office in 2 minutes from Belorusskaya Circle Line
  • Competitive salary
  • Corporate lunches
  • Medical and life insurance
  • 7 days of paid sick leaves (without sick leave certificate)
  • Corporate discount on company good
  • Flexible working time
  • Full compliance with Russian Labor Code
  • Fitness room, shower, partial fitness compensation
  • Company compensates relocation and interview expenses

About us:

  • Samsung AI Center – Moscow has been founded in 2018
  • We are sitting in White Square business center
  • We currently have three labs (Visual Understanding, Multimodal Data Analysis, Machine Learning)
  • …and many projects on such topics as:
    • Generation of photorealistic human avatars
    • Point clouds-based 3D image and video synthesis
    • Techniques for image manipulation using generative networks
    • Training neural networks using Bayesian methodsCreation of multi-agent systems
    • Single-view and multi-view 3D reconstruction
    • Localization and navigation using 3D vision
    • And more!
  • Over past three years, our researchers have published more than 30 papers at the world's best conferences on computer vision and machine learning, including CVPR, ICCV / ECCV, NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, IROS, WACV and others
